references.paper_title: Apprenticeship learning via inverse reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of inverse reinforcement learning, a core technique used and extended in the current work.

references.paper_title: Correlated equilibrium as an expression of Bayesian rationality
references.reason: This seminal paper introduces correlated equilibrium, a solution concept central to the multi-agent setting explored in this research.
This work provides crucial theoretical foundation for efficient imitation learning algorithms, which are generalized and adapted in the current work for multi-agent settings.

references.paper_title: Of moments and matching: A game-theoretic framework for closing the imitation gap
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the imitation gap problem in single-agent settings, providing valuable context and insights that this paper extends to the more challenging multi-agent scenario.
This work is highly influential in the area of inverse reinforcement learning and is fundamental to the techniques employed and extended in the context of this paper.
